title: Requires presence of conductors on all passenger railroad trains operated by the Staten Island
summary: Requires presence of conductors on all passenger railroad trains operated by the Staten Island railroad.
fulltext:
S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K
       ________________________________________________________________________

                                          351

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                 I N  A S S E M B L Y

                                      (PREFILED)

                                    January 5, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced by M. of A. CUSICK -- read once and referred to the Committee
         on Transportation

       AN  ACT  to amend the railroad law, in relation to requiring presence of
         conductors on all railroad passenger trains  operated  by  the  Staten
         Island railroad

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. The railroad law is amended by adding a new section 63-a to
    2  read as follows:
    3    S 63-A. CONDUCTORS REQUIRED. THE STATEN ISLAND RAILROAD, A  SUBSIDIARY
    4  OF  THE  METROPOLITAN  TRANSPORTATION  AUTHORITY,  SHALL PROVIDE FOR THE
    5  PRESENCE OF A CONDUCTOR ON EVERY PASSENGER TRAIN OPERATED BY SUCH  RAIL-
    6  ROAD.
    7    S  2.  This  act  shall take effect on the sixtieth day after it shall
    8  have become a law.






        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD00521-01-1
actClause: AN ACT to amend the railroad law, in relation to requiring presence of conductors on all railroad passenger trains operated by the Staten Island railroad
